com.sap.cloud.sdk.cloudplatform.cache

Class CacheKey

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sap.cloud.sdk.cloudplatform.cache.CacheKey

  • public class CacheKey
extends Object
    CacheKey with either global visibility, tenant isolation, or tenant & user isolation.

      • append

        public CacheKey append(CacheKey other,
                       Object... objects)
                throws UnmergeableCacheKeyException
        Appends the given CacheKey to this instance.
        Parameters:
        other - The CacheKey to append to this.
        objects - Additional objects that should be used to identify a cache key.
        Returns:
        This instance with the other key appended and the objects added.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given CacheKey is null.
        UnmergeableCacheKeyException - If the tenant or user in the isolation level of the given CacheKey is different from the respective tenant or user in this CacheKey.

      • append

        public CacheKey append(@Nullable
                       Object object,
                       Object... objects)
        Appends the given Objects to this instance. In order to compare cache keys, Object.equals(Object) and Object.hashCode() are used.
        Parameters:
        object - Additional object that should be used to identify a cache key.
        objects - Additional objects that should be used to identify a cache key.
        Returns:
        This instance with the objects added.

      • newEquallyIsolatedKey

        public static CacheKey newEquallyIsolatedKey(CacheKey cacheKey)
                                      throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                             UnmergeableCacheKeyException
        Returns a cache key with the same tenant and user isolation level as the given key.
        Parameters:
        cacheKey - The cache key to adopt the isolation level from.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey with the same isolation level as the given key.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException
        UnmergeableCacheKeyException

      • newGlobalKey

        public static CacheKey newGlobalKey(CacheKey cacheKey)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                    UnmergeableCacheKeyException
        Converts the given CacheKey to a globally visible CacheKey.
        Parameters:
        cacheKey - Cache key that is appended to the newly constructed key.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey for based on the given CacheKey.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given CacheKey is null.
        UnmergeableCacheKeyException - If the tenant or user in the isolation level of the given CacheKey is different from the respective tenant or user in this CacheKey.

      • newGlobalKey

        public static CacheKey newGlobalKey()
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey for a globally visible cache entry.

      • newTenantIsolatedKey

        public static CacheKey newTenantIsolatedKey(String tenantId)
                                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        tenantId - The tenant for which the CacheKey should be isolated.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey for a tenant-isolated cache entry.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given tenant is null.

      • newTenantIsolatedKey

        public static CacheKey newTenantIsolatedKey()
                                     throws TenantNotAvailableException,
                                            TenantAccessException
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey based on the current tenant.
        Throws:
        TenantNotAvailableException - If the tenant is not known. This typically occurs when trying to access the tenant within code that is running outside any tenant context, e.g., within a background task.
        TenantAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing the tenant.
        See Also:
        newTenantIsolatedKey(String)

      • newTenantIsolatedKey

        public static CacheKey newTenantIsolatedKey(CacheKey cacheKey,
                                            String tenantId)
                                     throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                            UnmergeableCacheKeyException
        Converts the given CacheKey to a tenant-isolated CacheKey.
        Parameters:
        cacheKey - Cache key that is appended to the newly constructed key.
        tenantId - The tenant for which the CacheKey should be isolated.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey for based on the given CacheKey.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given CacheKey or tenant is null.
        UnmergeableCacheKeyException - If the tenant or user in the isolation level of the given CacheKey is different from the respective tenant or user in this CacheKey.

      • newTenantIsolatedKey

        public static CacheKey newTenantIsolatedKey(CacheKey cacheKey)
                                     throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                            UnmergeableCacheKeyException
        Parameters:
        cacheKey - Cache key that is appended to the newly constructed key.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey based on the current tenant and the given key appended.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given CacheKey is null.
        UnmergeableCacheKeyException - If the tenant or user in the isolation level of the given CacheKey is different from the respective tenant or user in this CacheKey.
        See Also:
        newTenantIsolatedKey(CacheKey, String)

      • newUserIsolatedKey

        public static CacheKey newUserIsolatedKey(String tenantId,
                                          String userName)
                                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        tenantId - The tenant for which the CacheKey should be isolated.
        userName - The name of the user for which the CacheKey should be isolated.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey for a user- and tenant-isolated cache entry.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given tenant or user is null.

      • newUserIsolatedKey

        public static CacheKey newUserIsolatedKey(String userName)
                                   throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                          TenantNotAvailableException,
                                          TenantAccessException
        Parameters:
        userName - The name of the user for which the CacheKey should be isolated.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey based on the given user name.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given user is null.
        TenantNotAvailableException - If the tenant is not known. This typically occurs when trying to access the tenant within code that is running outside any tenant context, e.g., within a background task.
        TenantAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing the tenant.
        See Also:
        newUserIsolatedKey(String, String)

      • newUserIsolatedKey

        public static CacheKey newUserIsolatedKey()
                                   throws TenantNotAvailableException,
                                          TenantAccessException,
                                          UserNotAuthenticatedException,
                                          UserAccessException
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey based on the current tenant and user.
        Throws:
        TenantNotAvailableException - If the tenant is not known. This typically occurs when trying to access the tenant within code that is running outside any tenant context, e.g., within a background task.
        TenantAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing the tenant.
        UserNotAuthenticatedException - If the user is not authenticated.
        UserAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing the user.
        See Also:
        newUserIsolatedKey(String, String)

      • newUserIsolatedKey

        public static CacheKey newUserIsolatedKey(CacheKey cacheKey,
                                          String tenantId,
                                          String userName)
                                   throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                          UnmergeableCacheKeyException
        Converts the given CacheKey to a tenant-isolated CacheKey.
        Parameters:
        cacheKey - Cache key that is appended to the newly constructed key.
        tenantId - The tenant for which the CacheKey should be isolated.
        userName - The name of the user for which the CacheKey should be isolated.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey based on the given tenant, and user and the given CacheKey appended.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given CacheKey, tenant, or user is null.
        UnmergeableCacheKeyException - If the tenant or user in the isolation level of the given CacheKey is different from the respective tenant or user in this CacheKey.

      • newUserIsolatedKey

        public static CacheKey newUserIsolatedKey(CacheKey cacheKey,
                                          String userName)
                                   throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                          UnmergeableCacheKeyException,
                                          TenantNotAvailableException,
                                          TenantAccessException
        Parameters:
        cacheKey - Cache key that is appended to the newly constructed key.
        userName - The name of the user for which the CacheKey should be isolated.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey based on the given user and the given CacheKey appended.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given CacheKey or user is null.
        UnmergeableCacheKeyException - If the tenant or user in the isolation level of the given CacheKey is different from the respective tenant or user in this CacheKey.
        TenantNotAvailableException - If the tenant is not known. This typically occurs when trying to access the tenant within code that is running outside any tenant context, e.g., within a background task.
        TenantAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing the tenant.
        See Also:
        newUserIsolatedKey(CacheKey, String, String)

      • newUserIsolatedKey

        public static CacheKey newUserIsolatedKey(CacheKey cacheKey)
                                   throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                          UnmergeableCacheKeyException,
                                          TenantNotAvailableException,
                                          TenantAccessException,
                                          UserNotAuthenticatedException,
                                          UserAccessException
        Parameters:
        cacheKey - Cache key that is appended to the newly constructed key.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey based on the current user and the given CacheKey appended.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given CacheKey is null.
        UnmergeableCacheKeyException - If the tenant or user in the isolation level of the given CacheKey is different from the respective tenant or user in this CacheKey.
        TenantNotAvailableException - If the tenant is not known. This typically occurs when trying to access the tenant within code that is running outside any tenant context, e.g., within a background task.
        TenantAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing the tenant.
        UserNotAuthenticatedException - If the user is not authenticated.
        UserAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing the user.
        See Also:
        newUserIsolatedKey(CacheKey, String, String)

      • newUserOrTenantIsolatedKey

        public static CacheKey newUserOrTenantIsolatedKey()
                                           throws TenantNotAvailableException,
                                                  TenantAccessException
        Returns a tenant- and user-isolated cache key. If the user is not authenticated, only a tenant-isolated cache key is returned.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey based only on the current user, if available, otherwise based only on the current tenant.
        Throws:
        TenantNotAvailableException - If the tenant is not known. This typically occurs when trying to access the tenant within code that is running outside any tenant context, e.g., within a background task.
        TenantAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing the tenant.

      • newUserOrTenantIsolatedKey

        public static CacheKey newUserOrTenantIsolatedKey(CacheKey cacheKey)
                                           throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                                  UnmergeableCacheKeyException,
                                                  TenantNotAvailableException,
                                                  TenantAccessException
        Returns a tenant- and user-isolated cache key. If the user is not authenticated, only a tenant-isolated cache key is returned.
        Parameters:
        cacheKey - Cache key that is appended to the newly constructed key.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey based only on the current user, if available, otherwise based only on the current tenant. The given CacheKey is appended to the new key.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given CacheKey is null.
        UnmergeableCacheKeyException - If the tenant or user in the isolation level of the given CacheKey is different from the respective tenant or user in this CacheKey.
        TenantNotAvailableException - If the tenant is not known. This typically occurs when trying to access the tenant within code that is running outside any tenant context, e.g., within a background task.
        TenantAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing the tenant.
        See Also:
        newUserOrTenantIsolatedKey()

      • newTenantIsolatedOrGlobalKey

        public static CacheKey newTenantIsolatedOrGlobalKey()
        Returns a tenant-isolated cache key. If no tenant is available, a global cache key is returned.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey based only on the current tenant, if available, otherwise as a global key.

      • newTenantIsolatedOrGlobalKey

        public static CacheKey newTenantIsolatedOrGlobalKey(CacheKey cacheKey)
                                             throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                                    UnmergeableCacheKeyException
        Returns a tenant-isolated cache key. If no tenant is available, a global cache key is returned.
        Parameters:
        cacheKey - Cache key that is appended to the newly constructed key.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey based only on the current tenant, if available, otherwise as a global key. The given CacheKey is appended to the new key.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given CacheKey is null.
        UnmergeableCacheKeyException - If the tenant or user in the isolation level of the given CacheKey is different from the respective tenant or user in this CacheKey.

      • newBestEffortIsolatedKey

        public static CacheKey newBestEffortIsolatedKey()
        Returns a cache key with the highest possible (best effort) level of user and tenant isolation. If the user is not authenticated, a tenant-isolated cache key is returned. If no tenant is available, a global cache key is returned.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey based on the current tenant and user.

      • newBestEffortIsolatedKey

        public static CacheKey newBestEffortIsolatedKey(CacheKey cacheKey)
                                         throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                                UnmergeableCacheKeyException
        Returns a cache key with the highest possible (best effort) level of user and tenant isolation. If the user is not authenticated, a tenant-isolated cache key is returned. If no tenant is available, a global cache key is returned.
        Parameters:
        cacheKey - Cache key that is appended to the newly constructed key.
        Returns:
        A new CacheKey based on the current tenant and user. The given CacheKey is appended to the new key.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given CacheKey is null.
        UnmergeableCacheKeyException - If the tenant or user in the isolation level of the given CacheKey is different from the respective tenant or user in this CacheKey.
